snippet: Chemical weapons were used repeatedly in the Syria conflict this year, not only in a well-documented Aug. 21 attack but also in four other instances, a United Nations panels said.
abstract: United Nations report asserts that chemical weapons were used repeatedly in Syrian conflict in 2013, not only in the well-documented Aug 21 attack near Damascus.

byline.original: By SOMINI SENGUPTA and RICK GLADSTONE

lead_paragraph: Chemical weapons were used repeatedly in the Syria conflict this year, not only in a well-documented Aug. 21 attack but also in four other instances, a United Nations panels said.

headline.main: Chemical Arms Used Repeatedly in Syria, U.N. Says
headline.print_headline: U.N. Reports Attacks Using Chemicals In Syria
